markdownRemark.html: There's no place like home, which is great because we're going to be spending a lot of time here. We've made the decision to keep our isolation going for as long as it takes or as long as we're emotionally and mentally able. I wish there was some acceptable middle ground, but I'm afraid that there's no way for us to balance the risk. Last year we almost lost a child, and, having spent weeks many weeks hopeless, I feel like it's our responsibility to protect what fortune granted us. If school's re-open in the Fall, our boys will remain at home. We. There are many out there like us, so please remember them.
